title: On-Site hydrogen peroxide generator for effective, safe and sustainable irrigation water treatment
abstract: Greenhouses in Europe and Mediterranean produce 30% of the EU’s fruits and vegetables. Growing irrigation water resource pressures are driving greenhouse growers to use of more efficient irrigation techniques, and of non-potable water sources. These lead to a strong need for irrigation water treatment (IWT), to eliminate water-borne plant and human pathogens, mitigate clogging by bio-foul and secure reliable and uniform irrigation, and improve water oxygenation. Our goal is to bring to market a novel irrigation water treatment (IWT) solution based on our technology breakthroughs in on-site generation of hydrogen peroxide (H2O2). Our autonomous H2O2 generation device (HPGen) enables the safe, cost-effective and sustainable on-site generation of hydrogen peroxide, with only water, air and electricity as input. Hydrogen peroxide is a potent but eco-friendly disinfection agent, yet its use in IWT is very limited due the costs, risks and complexities of its present-day supply chain. HPGen will disrupt today’s H2O2 supply chain, enabling growers to reap the benefits of its use in IWT, substantially decreasing IWT and irrigation line maintenance costs, eliminating use of toxic-chemicals in IWT, improving farm safety, and increasing crop yields. HPGen will provide farmers with a positive economic impact of €4k-€5k per hectare per annum, while enhancing agriculture sustainability and reducing environmental impact. Technology breakthrough was made at the Danish Technical University 5 years ago, and a commercialization path was launched 2 years ago by HPNow ApS, a Danish SME. The company has since been highly successful in scaling up its technology, while attracting strong commercial partners, including global leaders in agriculture irrigation and in bulk hydrogen peroxide production, which are actively supporting this project. This project will initiate with pilot and customer trials of a full-scale version (TRL 6), and will end with commercial launch of HPGen (TRL 9).

motivations: Greenhouse growers face challenges in accessing efficient and safe irrigation water treatment solutions due to growing water resource pressures and the need to eliminate water-borne pathogens.
Current hydrogen peroxide supply chains for irrigation water treatment are costly, risky, and complex, limiting its use despite being a potent and eco-friendly disinfection agent.
objectives: Develop and commercialize an on-site hydrogen peroxide generator (HPGen) for safe, cost-effective, and sustainable irrigation water treatment.
Disrupt the current hydrogen peroxide supply chain and enable growers to benefit from its use in irrigation water treatment.
Improve farm safety, reduce environmental impact, and increase crop yields through the use of HPGen.
methods: Scale up and commercialize the HPGen technology, which generates hydrogen peroxide on-site using only water, air, and electricity as input.
Conduct pilot and customer trials of a full-scale version of HPGen to validate its effectiveness and safety.
Launch HPGen commercially and make it available to greenhouse growers.
results: Provide farmers with a positive economic impact of €4k-€5k per hectare per annum through reduced irrigation water treatment and maintenance costs.
Enhance agriculture sustainability and reduce environmental impact through the use of a safe and eco-friendly disinfection agent.
Improve crop yields and farm safety through the use of HPGen.
